speakers.title: CSO
speakers.bio:
With a unique combination of creative vision, client understanding, production knowledge, and business acumen, Kevin ‚Äì or ‚ÄúGrif‚Äù as he is known to his warm circle ‚Äì provides a guiding hand to all aspects of our events. One minute he‚Äôs analyzing a show budget and the next he‚Äôs discussing creative solutions to a technical puzzle or communication need. This balance of right brain/left brain has been honed through many years of event experience, along with continual education, including his master‚Äôs degree in business. A gifted moneyman, Grif owned/managed an accounting firm, communications company, and software firm before going back to his true passion, event production. Making roosters jealous, Grif is generally up before the crack of dawn blueprinting next steps, researching new ideas, and getting a jump on the day.¬†

Grif‚Äôs words to live by: Focus on being kind and having a positive attitude; it will change the world around you.¬†

badge_features.name: Speaker
badge_features.description: This is a speaker feature to show a speaker icon on the badge

speakers.title: Director of Event Management
speakers.bio: Kelley has over 20 years‚Äô event management experience with numerous high-profile companies, such as Apple, Facebook, Hewlett Packard, Palm Inc. and Intel. Managing events in scores of locations around the world, she has overseen a wide array of types and sizes of events: conferences, summits, tradeshows, launch events, sponsorships, roadshows, corporate parties and meetings. No stranger to complex budgeting, Kelley has been charged with managing event budgets upwards of $12 million. Kelley‚Äôs team of highly skilled event managers are second to none, and with them, she regularly orchestrates the meticulous planning process from venue selection and contract negotiations, registration to evening events, and everything in between. Kelley has a business degree from California Polytechnic, San Luis Obispo, with a concentration in Marketing.¬†

speakers.title: Creative Director
speakers.bio:
An imaginative, resourceful and strategic creative professional with 20+ years of experience in a myriad of visual art platforms, Heather is the ultimate idea wrangler. Skilled in both the artistic and logistic aspects of the development process, Heather possesses the ideal blend of creativity, ingenuity and grit necessary to see each project through to stunning completion. Heather‚Äôs background in marketing, communications, print/digital graphics, copywriting, web design, merchandizing, and event management helps ensure all teams are moving in conga-line sync.¬†

Most intense work experience: Completely redesigning and rerouting a 1500-person global summit in less than 24 hours when a Category 5 hurricane blew the entire beachfront venue to smithereens. Eeeekkk!

speakers.title: Sr Event Manager
speakers.bio: Kelly has over 13 years of corporate event experience, including 8 years of specializing in Expo, Sponsorships and Show Services Management. ¬†Assisting over 500+ sponsors. She has produced exhibit booths and experiences at industry tradeshows such as CES, Game Developer Conference America and EU, CTIA, Strata¬†Data Conference. Managed events for high profile companies including Facebook, Hewlett Packard, and Palm Inc. With experience on both sides of an exhibit floor I have played a key role in creating the FNTECH Sponsor Portal. This is a user-friendly portal, a one stop shop for sponsors to order services and turn in all sponsorship deliverables.¬†

social_description: test

speakers.title: CEO
speakers.bio:
Jeremy has over 25 years of experience in the event industry. In 1996, he and his business partner Chad Kropke founded FNTECH in a small shop in Huntington Beach, CA. Bob Moe soon joined them and together they grew FNTECH into a full-service production company with multiple locations, over 100 fulltime employees and millions in revenue. Jeremy began his career in production as an audio engineer and quickly moved up the ladder to technical director, project manager, and finally executive producer. Having a deep well of experience executing high-profile, multi-million dollar events all over the world, some with more than 120,000 in attendance, we can safely say that there‚Äôs a blue moon in the sky when Jeremy is surprised by anything event related.

Jeremy, his beloved guitar, and his stack of super-secret nerd books currently reside in Southern California with his wife and daughter.¬†

speakers.title: CSO
speakers.bio:
With a unique combination of creative vision, client understanding, production knowledge, and business acumen, Kevin ‚Äì or ‚ÄúGrif‚Äù as he is known to his warm circle ‚Äì provides a guiding hand to all aspects of our events. One minute he‚Äôs analyzing a show budget and the next he‚Äôs discussing creative solutions to a technical puzzle or communication need. This balance of right brain/left brain has been honed through many years of event experience, along with continual education, including his master‚Äôs degree in business. A gifted moneyman, Grif owned/managed an accounting firm, communications company, and software firm before going back to his true passion, event production. Making roosters jealous, Grif is generally up before the crack of dawn blueprinting next steps, researching new ideas, and getting a jump on the day.¬†

Grif‚Äôs words to live by: Focus on being kind and having a positive attitude; it will change the world around you.¬†

speakers.title: CEO
speakers.bio:
Jeremy has over 25 years of experience in the event industry. In 1996, he and his business partner Chad Kropke founded FNTECH in a small shop in Huntington Beach, CA. Bob Moe soon joined them and together they grew FNTECH into a full-service production company with multiple locations, over 100 fulltime employees and millions in revenue. Jeremy began his career in production as an audio engineer and quickly moved up the ladder to technical director, project manager, and finally executive producer. Having a deep well of experience executing high-profile, multi-million dollar events all over the world, some with more than 120,000 in attendance, we can safely say that there‚Äôs a blue moon in the sky when Jeremy is surprised by anything event related.

Jeremy, his beloved guitar, and his stack of super-secret nerd books currently reside in Southern California with his wife and daughter.¬†

One minute he‚Äôs analyzing a show budget and the next he‚Äôs discussing creative solutions to a technical puzzle or communication need. This balance of right brain/left brain has been honed through many years of event experience, along with continual education, including his master‚Äôs degree in business. A gifted moneyman, Grif owned/managed an accounting firm, communications company, and software firm before going back to his true passion, event production. badge_features.name: Speaker
badge_features.description: This is a speaker feature to show a speaker icon on the badge

speakers.title: Director of Event Management
speakers.bio: Kelley has over 20 years‚Äô event management experience with numerous high-profile companies, such as Apple, Facebook, Hewlett Packard, Palm Inc. and Intel. Managing events in scores of locations around the world, she has overseen a wide array of types and sizes of events: conferences, summits, tradeshows, launch events, sponsorships, roadshows, corporate parties and meetings. No stranger to complex budgeting, Kelley has been charged with managing event budgets upwards of $12 million. Kelley‚Äôs team of highly skilled event managers are second to none, and with them, she regularly orchestrates the meticulous planning process from venue selection and contract negotiations, registration to evening events, and everything in between. Kelley has a business degree from California Polytechnic, San Luis Obispo, with a concentration in Marketing.¬†

speakers.title: Creative Director
speakers.bio:
An imaginative, resourceful and strategic creative professional with 20+ years of experience in a myriad of visual art platforms, Heather is the ultimate idea wrangler. Skilled in both the artistic and logistic aspects of the development process, Heather possesses the ideal blend of creativity, ingenuity and grit necessary to see each project through to stunning completion. Heather‚Äôs background in marketing, communications, print/digital graphics, copywriting, web design, merchandizing, and event management helps ensure all teams are moving in conga-line sync.¬†

Most intense work experience: Completely redesigning and rerouting a 1500-person global summit in less than 24 hours when a Category 5 hurricane blew the entire beachfront venue to smithereens. Eeeekkk!

speakers.title: CEO
speakers.bio:
Jeremy has over 25 years of experience in the event industry. In 1996, he and his business partner Chad Kropke founded FNTECH in a small shop in Huntington Beach, CA. Bob Moe soon joined them and together they grew FNTECH into a full-service production company with multiple locations, over 100 fulltime employees and millions in revenue. Jeremy began his career in production as an audio engineer and quickly moved up the ladder to technical director, project manager, and finally executive producer. Having a deep well of experience executing high-profile, multi-million dollar events all over the world, some with more than 120,000 in attendance, we can safely say that there‚Äôs a blue moon in the sky when Jeremy is surprised by anything event related.

Jeremy, his beloved guitar, and his stack of super-secret nerd books currently reside in Southern California with his wife and daughter.¬†

speakers.title: Creative Director
speakers.bio:
An imaginative, resourceful and strategic creative professional with 20+ years of experience in a myriad of visual art platforms, Heather is the ultimate idea wrangler. Skilled in both the artistic and logistic aspects of the development process, Heather possesses the ideal blend of creativity, ingenuity and grit necessary to see each project through to stunning completion. Heather‚Äôs background in marketing, communications, print/digital graphics, copywriting, web design, merchandizing, and event management helps ensure all teams are moving in conga-line sync.¬†

Most intense work experience: Completely redesigning and rerouting a 1500-person global summit in less than 24 hours when a Category 5 hurricane blew the entire beachfront venue to smithereens. Eeeekkk!
